p: Data on intra-operative adverse events were available for 4 738 circumcisions. Of these, 341 (7.2%) intra-operative adverse events were reported. From the whole sample, 8.1% (n = 44) occurred during the 543 circumcisions done by doctors and 7.1% (n = 297) during the 4 195 circumcisions done by CAs (X 2 = 0.75; p = 0.385). Post-operative swelling within 2 days of the procedure was recorded for 1 460 clients, 30.2% (n = 1 299/4 195) were circumcised by CAs while 29.3% (n = 161/297) were circumcised by doctors. There were 53 (1.1%) cases of bleeding and 45 (1.1% of 4 195) were clients circumcised by CAs and 8 (1.5% of 297) were circumcisions done by doctors. There was no difference in adverse events such as swelling, pain, bleeding, infection and wound destruction between the circumcisions performed by CAs and doctors ( Table 3).
